alert.note: Alert for Throckmorton (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 22 at 8:28PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Throckmorton County through 915 PM CDT... At 828 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Us-183 Near The Throckmorton- Baylor County Line, or 8 miles east of Millers Creek Reservoir, moving southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Throckmorton, Woodson, Millers Creek Reservoir, Elbert, Us- 183 Near The Throckmorton-Baylor County Line and Lusk. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 100 AM CDT for west central Texas.
